numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts the likelihood that a legacy applicant is admitted into an elite college.
2. The graph compares a legacy applicant with a non-legacy applicant who has the same test scores.
3. A non-legacy applicant has no legacy advantage.
4. As the parents' income increases, the estimated legacy boost increases.
5. A legacy student can have parents.
6. Some parents rank in the top 0.1% of income.
7. A legacy student with parents who rank in the top 0.1% of income is 7 times more likely to be admitted into a school.
8. I wonder why there is less legacy boost for students with parents below the 50th percentile of income rank.
9. Some wealthier parents can donate more money than some less wealthy parents.
10. The ability of wealthier parents to donate more money may affect the graph.
12. The effect of financial aid may explain the graph.
14. My peers recently applied to college.
16. Two individuals can have similar academic statistics.
17. If an individual lacks legacy status then the individual is at a disadvantage for admissions.
18. The title of this graph is "The Legacy Advantage".
